article_title: Abbott rallies support for GOP hopeful in Texas House race
article_text:
Abbott rallies support for GOP hopeful in Texas House race

Photo: Kin Man Hui, San Antonio Express-News Texas Governor Greg Abbott makes an appearance in San Antonio to...

Claiming he needs “reinforcements” in Austin, Gov. Greg Abbott pleaded with a crowd of San Antonio voters Wednesday to elect the Republican running in the special election runoff in Texas House District 123.

article_metadata.description: Claiming he needs “reinforcements” in Austin, Gov. Greg Abbott pleaded with a crowd of San Antonio voters Wednesday to elect the Republican running in the special election runoff in Texas House District 123.  With early voting underway for Tuesday’s election, Abbott endorsed GOP candidate Nunzio Previtera in his showdown with Democrat Diego Bernal for the seat vacated by state Rep. Mike Villarreal, who’s running for mayor.  Previtera, 62, owner of Integrity Insurance Agency, serves on the State Republican Executive Committee and is making his first run for office.  The 38-year-old attorney, who served on City Council from 2011 to 2014, advocates increased funding for public schools, full-day pre-K and preparing students for jobs.
article_metadata.author.name: By John W. Gonzalez, Staff Writer

The 38-year-old attorney, who served on City Council from 2011 to 2014, advocates increased funding for public schools, full-day pre-K and preparing students for jobs.
